content: granny s baby log cabin blanket this combination of two classics works up quickly into the perfect blanket for a little one with nearly infinite possibilities in choice of yarn and colors you re sure to create a blankie that will be carried and cuddled for years to come materials approximately 1200 yards of soft worsted weight acrylic yarn in your choice of colors and a size h 5 00 mm crochet hook or your choice of alternate yarn and appropriate hook this may affect total yarn needed safety pin or scrap of yarn for marking right side tapestry needle for weaving ends abbreviations u s notation chain chain stitch double_crochet…double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch space…space special stitches 2-double_crochet cluster 2 double_crochet in same stitch or space 3-double_crochet cluster 3 double_crochet in same stitch or space notes because most of this blanket is worked in row rather than rounds the starting granny square is turned over at the beginning of each round so as to retain a consistent texture with the rest of the piece the edging is also worked in this fashion if you choose multiple row of edging after the starting granny i use a chain-2 to get up to height on my row as i find a chain- 3 to be just a bit too tall use whichever you find works the best for you edging if you prefer to work rounds in multiple colors simply fasten_off after each one and rejoin as you would with a traditional granny square you might also prefer to add a final round of simple edging like a round of double_crochet the possibilities are endless…have fun with it finished size approximately 36 by 36 inches 91 by 91 cm afghan pictured was made with 5 skeins of red heart soft yarn 5 oz per skein/256 yds worsted weight/4/medium recommended gauge with an i hook 12 single_crochet and 15 row per 4 inches in the following colors 4601 off white 9114 honey 4422 tangerine 9522 leaf and 9520 seafoam the pattern initial granny square with your first color chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form ring round 1 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet 2 double_crochet in ring chain 2 *work 3-double_crochet cluster in ring chain 2 * repeat from * to * two more times then join with a slip_stitch to the top of initial chain- 3 4 3-double_crochet clusters 4 chain-2 spaces mark this as the right side with a piece of scrap yarn or a safety pin round 2 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet and turn the work over 2-double_crochet cluster in next chain-2 space chain 2 3-double_crochet cluster in same chain-2 space chain 1 first corner complete *in next chain- 2 space work 3-double_crochet cluster chain 2 3-double_crochet cluster chain 1 * repeat from * to * two more times join with slip_stitch to top of initial chain-3 8 3-double_crochet clusters 4 chain-2 spaces 4 chain-1 space round 3 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet and turn the work
